description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5mvg9","text":"Human Placenta Tissue collection and storage protocol for HuBMAP's UCSD Female Reproductive TMC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: Human Placenta Tissue Collection and Preservation Methods - UCSD Female Reproductive TMC

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

keywords: HuBMAP, UCSD Female Reproductive TMC, Placenta
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"3toog","text":"Sterile surgical dissecting instruments (scissors/forceps)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1bi1r","text":"Gauze pad","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26hk7","text":"Petri dish","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49acg","text":"Sterile 1X PBS (cold, from fridge)","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10l0i","text":"Liquid Nitrogen ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvk3n","text":"Empty microfuge tubes x9","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48sl7","text":"Microfuge tubes pre-filled with RNA later x9","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gs03","text":"10% Formalin filled tubes x2","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enpdl","text":"MACS tissue buffer filled tubes x4 or OCT compound and cryomolds x4 ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d5oe1","text":"Collect placenta from delivery room within 1 hour of delivery.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5d5ct","text":"Place placenta into bucket and photograph prior to sampling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tupt","text":"Select 2 sites (A and B) from which samples will be collected. Aim for sites to be equidistant from the cord, avoid the edges, avoid areas with fibrin deposits/infarcts/necrosis and/or large blood vessels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5e8nj","text":"From site A, cut a circle all the way down from the fetal to the maternal surface, about one inch in diameter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":5,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vqpn","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"76u2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52B851EB345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":187,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture1.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsb5bqbkx.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsb3bqbkx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gsb4bqbkx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsb2bqbkx.webp","width":187}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mfqv","text":"Wash the full-thickness core in cold PBS in a petri dish. Keep the fetal surface pointing up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djo9f","text":"      ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"m0r8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52B9FB18345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":198.38202247191015,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture2.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsb9bqbkx.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsb7bqbkx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gsb8bqbkx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsb6bqbkx.webp","width":187.82978723404256}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8vcj2","text":"Divide the full core in half vertically, from fetal to maternal surface.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h4j8","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"hgfg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52BBC515345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":197.8314606741574,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture2b.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscdbqbkx.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscbbqbkx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gsccbqbkx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscabqbkx.webp","width":187.30851063829797}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79iqm","text":"With the left half of site A, divide the core horizontally into fetal (F), central (C) and maternal (M) regions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":9,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbfvh","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9157t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52BD7533345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":184.10471204188474,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture3a.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gschbqbkx.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscfbqbkx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gscgbqbkx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscebqbkx.webp","width":188.04278074866312}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8qbv","text":"Cut each of the three regions from the previous step into 6 small chunks for a total of 18 chunks. Chunks should be small enough to just cover the bottom of a microfuge tube (~5mm x 5mm x 5mm). Collect tissue directly adjacent to the fetal and maternal membranes but do not cut from the membranes themselves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":267,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1ft2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dhfv9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52BF015E345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":195.2614678899082,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture4.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscmbqbkx.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscjbqbkx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gsckbqbkx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscibqbkx.webp","width":189.18666666666684}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5dpqp","text":"With the right half of site A, divide the tissue into 4 quadrants so that you have 2 fetal chunks and 2 maternal chunks, keeping all the membranes intact. Some of the central region tissue may need to be trimmed off if the core is very thick.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":9,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fthmm","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8236v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52C07788345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":182.37696335078533,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture3.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscrbqbkx.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscpbqbkx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gscqbqbkx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscnbqbkx.webp","width":186.27807486631}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8gt7","text":"Place one fetal piece and one maternal piece into the 10% formalin tubes (to be processed into FFPE blocks). Place the other fetal and maternal piece into cold MACS tissue buffer. Store in 4C fridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lm17","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4gg6h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"52C2A566345011EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":187.41150442477868,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Picture5.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscvbqbkx.jpg","shadow":true,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gsctbqbkx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gscubqbkx.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gscsbqbkx.webp","width":188.24444444444453}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blshu","text":"Alternatively, if not collecting into MACS tissue buffer, freeze the other fetal and maternal piece in OCT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bb0ku","text":"Fill plastic cryomold halfway with OCT compound being careful not to create bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"15hnc","text":"Place fetal tissue (membrane side pointing up) in one mold and maternal tissue (membrane side pointing down) in another mold.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bt0bh","text":"Cover tissue with a thin layer of OCT compound being careful not to create bubbles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69dm7","text":"Repeat Steps 4-10 with placenta Site B.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":32,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c659","text":"Slowly lower the mold into liquid nitrogen until the whole block freezes, then store in -80C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fctjp","text":"Take photos of the placenta after both sites (A and B) are removed. Measure the distance from the cord insertion to each sampling site.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n016","text":"Dab the small chunks on a sterile gauze pad and place each one into a labeled microfuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9khlu","text":"Place 9 small chunks (3 fetal, 3 central, 3 maternal) into the empty tubes to be snap frozen. Drop tubes into liquid Nitrogen. Leave for ~2-10 minutes. Remove and store in -80C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ec0am","text":"Place the other 9 chunks (3 fetal, 3 central, 3 maternal) into the RNAlater filled tubes. Place RNAlater tubes into a 4C fridge. Allow to sit for 24-48 hours, then remove the RNAlater with a sterile transfer pipette and store in -80C freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9i486","text":"Tissue samples are removed from the formalin and rinsed in DI water. Water is changed multiple times until it is relatively clear and free of extraneous blood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4odi0","text":"Place basket in Station 2 of the Leica Processor","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eui91","text":"Set Processor to program #1 (stations and timing listed below) and start time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctbi4","text":"The following steps for dehydration and clearing are used:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmj7v","text":"NOTE: All steps are under vacuum","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fi0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30hsj","text":"STATION           TIME    TEMPERATURE             SOLUTION","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":58}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23tvp","text":"2                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-SOFT DEHYDRANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2at27","text":"3                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-SOFT DEHYDRANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9eu98","text":"4                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-SOFT DEHYDRANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e60n6","text":"5                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-SOFT DEHYDRANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gdku","text":"6                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-SOFT DEHYDRANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mjn4","text":"7                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-SOFT DEHYDRANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"etssu","text":"8                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-PAR CLEARANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vkeg","text":"9                      1hr       Room temperature        PRO-PAR CLEARANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tk6h","text":"10                    1hr       Room temperature        PRO-PAR CLEARANT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0msp","text":"11                     1hr       57C                                TYPE 3 WAX","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"208nm","text":"12                     1hr       57C                                TYPE 3 WAX","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fon0d","text":"Transfer the cassettes from the basket to the Leica embedding station","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eq2bc","text":"Choose an appropriately sized embedding mold from the embedding mold tray","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8c65","text":"Using forceps, place the sample with the face of interest at the bottom of the mold","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5kenp","text":"Fill the mold with wax from the dispenser","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a39un","text":"Place the cassette on top of the embedding mold and fill the cassette with wax (Type 9)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f504e","text":"Place the embedding mold containing the tissue and cassette onto the cold plate to solidify","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajbp9","text":"Once the wax has solidified (~ 20 minutes), use a utility knife to remove the cassette from the mold","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6a35r","text":"Scrape off excess wax on the side of the blocks; Blocks are now ready to be sectioned or stored","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
